intro: Spergula morisonii proles linicola, commonly known as the Linseed Spergula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, disturbed soils. This species is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and other open areas where it can spread efficiently through its prolific seed production.
